elements.title: Deshong Art Museum
elements.contents: ... that a teenage boy stole over US$300,000 worth of paintings from the Deshong Art Museum (pictured) by simply taking them off the wall and sliding them through a window?

elements.title: Güzin Müjde Karakaşlı
elements.contents: ... that Turkish carom billiards champion Güzin Müjde Karakaşlı grew up playing volleyball for about 12 years?

elements.title: North Nias Regency
elements.contents: ... that North Nias Regency demolished its own government buildings in 2018 for urban renewal?

elements.title: Noveloa
elements.contents: ... that pollution in rivers scatters far-red light, making it harder for plants like Noveloa to germinate?

elements.title: Lessons in Chemistry
elements.contents: ... that while writing Lessons in Chemistry, the author self-studied chemistry and was a full-time copywriter?

elements.title: Martha Poma
elements.contents: ... that Martha Poma worked as a textile artisan in El Alto before being elected to the Bolivian senate?

elements.title: Canticle I: My beloved is mine and I am his
elements.contents: ... that Benjamin Britten composed Canticle I: My beloved is mine and I am his for the tenor voice of Peter Pears, using poetry from A Divine Rapture by Francis Quarles?

elements.title: Marc-Auguste Pictet demonstrated the apparent reflection of cold by mirrors
elements.contents: ... that in 1790, ten years before the discovery of infrared heating of the Earth by the Sun, Marc-Auguste Pictet demonstrated the apparent reflection of cold by mirrors?
